lead_paragraph: While the British Eighth Army was fighting its way westward across Libya and Tunisia, an American contingent was constantly with that army, sharing the heat, the cold, the dust, the privations and the shellfire. It was the American Field Service, the volunteer ambulance corps, which for many months has been working with the British and the Fighting French.
abstract: Amer Field Service: ed on work
